SENT.plain: Tretinoin is effective in acute promyelocytic leukaemia in adults
Data about its efficacy and safety in children are limited
We have treated 9 children with tretinoin at 45 mg/m2 per day
Pseudotumour cerebri or hyperleucocytosis occurred in 5 patients
Retinoic acid syndrome was seen in 3 cases
1 of 2 children who developed hyperleucocytosis, pseudotumour cerebri, and retinoic acid syndrome died despite steroids and mechanical ventilation
Complete remissions with tretinoin alone were achieved in 15 patients
All 8 surviving children received consolidation chemotherapy
Our experience with tretinoin therapy suggests that toxicity is frequent in children
